page.title: 05Peat Cutting Tongue
page.content: Peat is formed when rotting vegetat ion is compresed over the years until it forms a black substance which, when dried, will burn well and give a clear fierce heat. Peat covers large parts of the Highlands and is dug by the crofters and used for fuel. A {flaughter spade} has a curved shaft a cross bar and a sharp blade for skimming the surface off the peat. Then a{talisker}with a flanged blade is used for cutting the soft peat.The cut blocks measuring approx 25cmx15cmx 20cm are thrown out on to the banks to dry after which they are built into little heaps where the wind can dry them thoroughly. At a convenient time they are taken home usually by tractor and built into a peat stack near the house.
